metadata.name: DEMO ONLY: Research Software Description Mode
metadata.description: A draft Crate-O Mode for describing research software soure code / notebooks / workflows
metadata.author: University of Queensland

inputs.name: name
inputs.help: The name of the Software

inputs.name: description
inputs.help: A description of the software.

inputs.name: datePublished
inputs.help: Date of first broadcast/publication.

inputs.name: license
inputs.help: A license document that applies to this content this should be included in the RO-Crate as a CreativeWork

inputs.name: mainEntity
inputs.help: Indicates the primary entry

inputs.name: creator
inputs.help: The creator/author of this CreativeWork. This is the same as the Author property for CreativeWork.

inputs.name: publisher
inputs.help: The publisher of the creative work.

inputs.name: downloadUrl
inputs.help: If the file can be downloaded, URL to download the binary.

inputs.name: installUrl
inputs.help: URL at which the app may be installed, if different from the URL of the item.

inputs.name: releaseNotes
inputs.help: Description of what changed in this version.

inputs.name: screenshot
inputs.help: A link to a screenshot image of the app.

inputs.name: softwareVersion
inputs.help: Version of the software instance.

inputs.name: softwareRequirements
inputs.help: Component dependency requirements for application. This includes runtime environments and shared libraries that are not included in the application distribution package, but required to run the application (examples: DirectX, Java or .NET runtime).

inputs.name: softwareHelp
inputs.help: Software application help.

inputs.name: programmingLanguage
inputs.help: The computer programming language.

inputs.name: codeRepository
inputs.help: Link to the repository where the un-compiled, human readable code and related code is located (SVN, GitHub, CodePlex).

inputs.name: funder
inputs.help: A person or organization that supports (sponsors) something through some kind of financial contribution.

inputs.name: citation
inputs.help: A citation or reference to another creative work, such as another publication, web page, scholarly article, etc.

inputs.name: usageInfo
inputs.help:
The schema.org [[usageInfo]] property indicates further information about a [[CreativeWork]]. This property is applicable both to works that are freely available and to those that require payment or other transactions. It can reference additional information, e.g. community expectations on preferred linking and citation conventions, as well as purchasing details. For something that can be commercially licensed, usageInfo can provide detailed, resource-specific information about licensing options.

This property can be used alongside the license property which indicates license(s) applicable to some piece of content. The usageInfo property can provide information about other licensing options, e.g. acquiring commercial usage rights for an image that is also available under non-commercial creative commons licenses.

inputs.name: hasPart
inputs.help: Indicates an item or CreativeWork that is part of this item, or CreativeWork (in some sense).

inputs.name: supportingData
inputs.help: Supporting data for a SoftwareApplication.

inputs.name: runtime
inputs.help: Runtime platform or script interpreter dependencies (example: Java v1, Python 2.3, .NET Framework 3.0).

inputs.name: availableOnDevice
inputs.help: Device required to run the application. Used in cases where a specific make/model is required to run the application.

inputs.name: identifier
inputs.help: The identifier property represents any kind of identifier for any kind of [[Thing]], such as ISBNs, GTIN codes, UUIDs etc. Schema.org provides dedicated properties for representing many of these, either as textual strings or as URL (URI) links. See [background notes](/docs/datamodel.html#identifierBg) for more details.

inputs.help: The subject matter of the content.

inputs.name: datePublished
inputs.help: Date of first broadcast/publication.

inputs.name: license
inputs.help: A license document that applies to this content, typically indicated by URL.

inputs.name: mainEntity
inputs.help: Indicates the primary entity described in some page or other CreativeWork.

inputs.help: The creator/author of this CreativeWork. This is the same as the Author property for CreativeWork.
